Key Match Events: Sri Lanka posted a 5 wicket win over the West Indies in the first one-day international at the Pallekele International Cricket Stadium.
The Windies made 185/4 in 38.3 overs in the rain-hit match before the hosts made 234/5 in 31.5 overs of the truncated 37 overs to clinch the game on DLS method with 31 deliveries to spare.
Charith Asalanka was named Player of the Match for his performance.
Sherfane Rutherford and Roston Chase had a promising partnership before the rain affected the match.
Gudakesh Motie was brilliant with the ball but lacked support from the rest of the team.
Nishan Madushka and Charith Asalanka added close to 150 runs for Sri Lanka.
Kamindu Mendis hit the winning runs with a six.
Post-Match Reflections: Charith Asalanka expressed that it was a convincing win and mentioned the plan was to attack and be positive with the bat.
Shai Hope mentioned that the weather and conditions were challenging and emphasized the need for better performance from the top order.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was affected by rain, leading to a revised target based on the DLS method.
